channel.title: Kickstarter official date, tier rewards, and stretch goals unveiled!
channel.description: ## We have an official [Kickstarter section on our Wikia](https://tol.wikia.com/wiki/Kickstarter) for more information, showing official date range, tier rewards, stretch goals, and clarifications. Check it out! The core tier is **[$10 for 2 keys](http://tol.wikia.com/wiki/Kickstarter)**. [](https://tol.wikia.com/wiki/Kickstarter)

item.title: Kickstarter official date, tier rewards, and stretch goals unveiled!
item.dc:creator: í42-Xblade
item.description:
(Edited after I had a chance to revisit the page off my phone):

wolf:

These rewards seem greedy at best.

Most have said we are generous during our surveys, so I’m a bit surprised you feel that way I apologize for that. I’ll be sure to relay your suggestions to the team! Are you sure you noticed the other rewards that tier included?

Our core reward tier is 2 keys for $10 and we promise the game pretty fast – this is probably the best I’ve ever seen on a Kickstarter To compare, I usually end up spending $25 for 1 key (core tier) and no other rewards, then wait a year for the game. Most of the other tiers have more keys than the tier itself is worth with just keys alone ♫

wolf:

A few examples:
First tier to get exclusive in-game prefix
42 dollars

+6 keys ($60 value alone) and tons of gold among other things ~ You cannot just see it as the first in-game prefix it includes quite a lot:

Pasted image82×838 9.87 KB

wolf:

First tier to get exclusive in-game armor/sword
125 dollars

+10 ($100 value alone) keys and others as well including a physical item and tons of gold compared to the other tiers

Pasted image170×849 16.5 KB

EDIT: ALL tiers get a forum title. The title is at the top (even the $5 one).

Read full topic
item.source: Kickstarter official date, tier rewards, and stretch goals unveiled!

item.title: Kickstarter official date, tier rewards, and stretch goals unveiled!
item.dc:creator: í42-Xblade
item.description:
FadeBlade:

what’s up with the Demand Justice group reward?

The only thing we’d START with is to have a report button which will simply email the devs to manually look into it when we can spare the time (less time available during alpha/beta, more time during release).

This is very different than an actual system that could automate this stuff, be smart and discipline them without developer interaction. Everyone would have a hidden set of Reputation points. The more reputable you are, the more your reports count. Maybe even have a tribunal system inspired by League of Legends. We’d probably take community feedback when ready to implement.

The current way doesn’t guarantee anything will actually happen. I call it Ghetto Report. We should probably add that to clarification section.

If we don’t reach that stretch goal, we’ll have an epic system one day, but would need to gather resources first.

EDIT: Added to clarifications section

Read full topic
item.source: Kickstarter official date, tier rewards, and stretch goals unveiled!

item.title: Kickstarter official date, tier rewards, and stretch goals unveiled!
item.dc:creator: SoulShard
item.description:
speaking of greedy what’s up with the Demand Justice group reward? I can understand everything else but the ability to report. probably our only way for us to get rid of game thrower’s, cheaters etc. we need to pay for that?

Read full topic
item.source: Kickstarter official date, tier rewards, and stretch goals unveiled!

item.title: Kickstarter official date, tier rewards, and stretch goals unveiled!
item.dc:creator: wolf
item.description:
I have followed this game for quite some time. As someone who enjoys mafia style games and town of salem alot, I was excited to see that something similar is being worked on.

I had really high hopes for Throne of Lies because 1. it’s slightly different 2. the name is awesome 3. the town of salem holds the monopoly in the market for these games.

However after seeing the reward tiers, I am disappointed. These rewards seem greedy at best.

http://tol.wikia.com/wiki/Kickstarter

A few examples:
First tier to get exclusive in-game prefix
42 dollars

First tier to get exclusive in-game armor/sword
125 dollars

Anyhow. Good luck with the campaign. I hope the game will turn out well will support you (if the game is good and has been launched on steam or will be bundled in future).

The current kickstarter rewards seem greedy to me and do not reflect the indie nature and pre-release state of the game.

Cheers

Read full topic
